title: Qaiser urges PTI to work for resolving people’s problems, avoid agitation
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 10 (APP):Federal Minister for Maritime Affairs Qaiser Ahmed Sheikh on Tuesday urged the leaders of Pakistan Tehreek e Insaf (PTI), to work for resolving people’s problems.
The PTI should avoid politics of agitation and using uncivilized language against the leaders of national institutions, he said this while talking to a private television channel.
There was a need to address economic issues but PTI was creating political unrest in the country, he said.
In reply to a question about language used by chief minister Khyber Pakhtunkhawa, he said that CM KP should behave
as a responsible politician and desist from promoting such culture in the society.
He requested all the political parties particularly opposition members to sit on the negotiating table for resolving political issues. He said, we should work for economic prosperity and political stability to strengthen democratic system.
